gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew
gospel.text:
[[Mt 13,54]]Jesus came to his native place and taught the people in their synagogue. They were astonished and said, "Where did this man get such wisdom and mighty deeds?
[[Mt 13,55]]Is he not the carpenter's son? Is not his mother named Mary and his brothers James, Joseph, Simon, and Judas?
[[Mt 13,56]]Are not his sisters all with us? Where did this man get all this?"
[[Mt 13,57]]And they took offense at him. But Jesus said to them, "A prophet is not without honor except in his native place and in his own house."
[[Mt 13,58]]And he did not work many mighty deeds there because of their lack of faith.

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 81,3]]Take up a melody, and sound the timbrel, 
the pleasant harp and the lyre.
[[Ps 81,4]]Blow the trumpet at the new moon, 
at the full moon, on our solemn feast.

[[Ps 81,5]]For it is a statute in Israel, 
an ordinance of the God of Jacob,
[[Ps 81,6a]]Who made it a decree for Joseph
[[Ps 81,6b]]when he came forth from the land of Egypt.  

[[Ps 81,10]]“There shall be no strange god among you 
nor shall you worship any alien god.
[[Ps 81,11a]]I, the LORD, am your God
[[Ps 81,11b]]who led you forth from the land of Egypt."

first_reading.title: Book of Leviticus
first_reading.text:
[[Lv 23,1]]The LORD said to Moses,
[[Lv 23,4]]"These, then, are the festivals of the LORD which you shall celebrate at their proper time with a sacred assembly.
[[Lv 23,5]]The Passover of the LORD falls on the fourteenth day of the first month, at the evening twilight.
[[Lv 23,6]]The fifteenth day of this month is the LORD'S feast of Unleavened Bread. For seven days you shall eat unleavened bread.
[[Lv 23,7]]On the first of these days you shall hold a sacred assembly and do no sort of work.
[[Lv 23,8]]On each of the seven days you shall offer an oblation to the LORD. Then on the seventh day you shall again hold a sacred assembly and do no sort of work."
[[Lv 23,9]]The LORD said to Moses,
[[Lv 23,10]]"Speak to the Israelites and tell them: When you come into the land which I am giving you, and reap your harvest, you shall bring a sheaf of the first fruits of your harvest to the priest,
[[Lv 23,11]]who shall wave the sheaf before the LORD that it may be acceptable for you. On the day after the sabbath the priest shall do this.
[[Lv 23,15]]"Beginning with the day after the sabbath, the day on which you bring the wave-offering sheaf, you shall count seven full weeks,
[[Lv 23,16]]and then on the day after the seventh week, the fiftieth day, you shall present the new cereal offering to the LORD.
[[Lv 23,27]]"The tenth of this seventh month is the Day of Atonement, when you shall hold a sacred assembly and mortify yourselves and offer an oblation to the LORD.
[[Lv 23,34b]]"Tell the Israelites: The fifteenth day of this seventh month is the LORD'S feast of Booths, which shall continue for seven days.
[[Lv 23,35]]On the first day there shall be a sacred assembly, and you shall do no sort of work.
[[Lv 23,36]]For seven days you shall offer an oblation to the LORD, and on the eighth day you shall again hold a sacred assembly and offer an oblation to the LORD. On that solemn closing you shall do no sort of work.
[[Lv 23,37]]"These, therefore, are the festivals of the LORD on which you shall proclaim a sacred assembly, and offer as an oblation to the LORD holocausts and cereal offerings, sacrifices and libations, as prescribed for each day."
